DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate whether objective compliance monitoring increase mandibular advancement device ( MAD ) usage obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) patient . Half participant assign objective compliance monitoring group ( experimental group ) , assign subjective compliance monitoring group ( control group ) . A physician prescribe explain patient base data objective subjective compliance monitoring .
DOC.brief_title: Can Objective Compliance Monitoring Increase Mandibular Advancement Device Usage Obstructive Sleep Apnea Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The design study randomize control trial . Total 40 participant randomly divide 2 group : objective compliance monitoring ( n=20 ) subjective compliance monitoring ( n=20 ) . Both group wear MAD ( commercial name : SomnoDent Flex DentiTrac ) . They visit Seol National University Hospital 1 , 3 , 6 month initiation MAD . A research coordinator acquire data download MAD ask patient , transfer information physician . If patient belongs objective compliance group , data MAD transfer physician . But patient belongs subjective compliance group , data acquire ask patient transferred physician . A physician prescribe explain patient base data objective subjective compliance monitoring.The primary aim examine effectiveness SomnoDent Flex DentiTrac , term compliance .
DOC.criteria: obstructive sleep apnea patient without history soft palate surgery moderate severe periodontal disease . central sleep apnea active mandibular disease tooth grind moderate severe periodontal disease
